image.altText: Marilyn adjusts Audra's wedding veil

props.synopsis: Marilyn Rulyancich's baby was snatched from her during Australia's forced adoption era. But she never gave up hope of seeing her again — and now she's telling her remarkable story of subterfuge, detective work and sheer determination.

title.children: When Audra got married, she had no idea her mother she never met was standing right behind her

image.altText: A composite image of Jeremy Rockliff and Rebecca White on election night.

props.synopsis: Despite calling an early election to regain majority government, the Tasmanian Liberals have fallen short. But so too has Labor. Here's what will happen next.

title.children: Confused about the Tasmanian election result? You are not alone

image.altText: Suncorp general manager Alan Graham, Premier Steven Miles and former rugby league great Wally Lewis in front of Olympics rings.

props.synopsis: Queensland's premier has vetoed the construction of a new stadium at Victoria Park that had been suggested could "rival" the MCG. So what lasting impact will the Olympic Games have on Brisbane?

title.children: Brisbane won't get a stadium to 'rival the MCG', so what will its Olympic legacy be?

image.altText: A man stands in a carpark speaking to the media with the glow of a burning building behind him

props.synopsis: Four people have recounted the night terrorists stormed a Moscow concert hall and unleashed unspeakable terror that left more than 143 people dead.

title.children: 'Simply a nightmare': Eyewitnesses recount horror of Moscow terror attack

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine attend a ceremony. Catherine is wearing a large red hat.

props.synopsis: Catherine, Princess of Wales, and her husband Prince William have been "enormously touched" by the messages of support received since she announced her cancer diagnosis, a Kensington Palace spokesperson says.

title.children: Princess Kate and Prince William say they are 'enormously touched' by messages of support

image.altText: A drone shot shows five vehicles involved in a highway crash.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a multi-vehicle crash on the Bruce Highway that killed three people.

title.children: Three dead, three 'lucky to be alive' after Maryborough crash

image.altText: A pink building.

props.synopsis: India has denied killing Hardeep Singh Nijjar, but an ABC investigation has found evidence government agencies were searching his family home in Punjab in the weeks before his death.

title.children: What happened at this pink building in remote India could hold new clues in a killing that rocked the world

image.altText: Julia Baird, who has short brown-blonde hair and is wearing a black wetsuit, looks over the ocean in morning sunlight

props.synopsis: One of the greatest myths is that by just being positive, or cheerful, we can somehow erase our problems.What I'm more interested in is the simpler question of: how do we go on?

title.children: 'Seven times down, eight times up': When life is hard, how do we go on?

image.altText: A close-up of an eastern brown snake -- you can see its large black eye and irregular brown scales

props.synopsis: With venom that can induce death in less than half an hour, it's no surprise the eastern brown snake is responsible for the highest number of snake fatalities in Australia.

title.children: Don’t be fooled by its small fangs. One bite from this snake can kill you in less than 30 minutes

image.altText: A woman at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Real Estate Institute of Queensland says a focus on greater rights for tenants is diminishing the authority of property owners and overriding contractual freedoms.

title.children: Rent bidding shutdown, increase restrictions will harm landlord confidence, real estate lobby says

image.altText: The outside of a Medibank branch.

props.synopsis: As private health premiums are set to rise, some Australians are making a conscious decision to opt for "self-insurance" rather than "health insurance" to cut down on expenses. Experts warn it's not for everyone.

title.children: With health insurance premiums about to increase, these people decided to 'self-fund' their private healthcare instead

image.altText: A slightly smiling middle-aged woman leans against a wooden post, in front of a beach. Dark curly hair, glasses, blue top.

props.synopsis: A growing proportion of older couples in relationships that span over decades are splitting up, with about one in four divorces taking place after the age of 50. But experts warn it could have significant implications for the wider society.

title.children: Leanne separated from her spouse of 20 years when she was 53. She's not alone

image.altText: A lady with blonde hair in a blue shirt standing next to a large pile of white goods at a dump and a sign saying white goods

props.synopsis: Electrical appliances are piling up at Thargomindah's rubbish tip after damage caused by an unstable power supply, and there isn't much locals can do about it.

title.children: White goods graveyard in outback town caused by storms hundreds of kilometres away

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Don't be shy now, you think you know it all. Prove it. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: A woman in a tiara and blue cape in a carriage

props.synopsis: The palace has a difficult job ahead managing the public's insatiable desire for information, respecting Catherine's treatment and privacy, and calming speculation in the digital age, writes Isabella Higgins.

title.children: Kate has asked for a reprieve. Her request will test the palace, the tabloids and her future subjects

image.altText: Profile of Waxahatchee's Katie Crutchfield standing outside in floral print shirt

props.synopsis: On her new album Tigers Blood, Waxahatchee finds clever ways to sing about love and childhood memories without delving into cliche.

title.children: Is this the best alt-country album of the year? Get to know Waxahatchee

image.altText: Graphic image with Donald Trump appearing above images of Tim Scott, Kristi Noem and Marjorie Taylor Greene.

props.synopsis: A gun-loving grandma, a former Democrat and a MAGA frontwoman — who will Donald Trump pick from his long shortlist of running mates? And will his pick be based on strategy or aesthetics?

title.children: 'Out of central casting': Could Donald Trump choose this woman as running mate?

image.altText: bushfire at night

props.synopsis: Fire crews are battling a major blaze which has burnt through the night in southern Western Australia.

title.children: 'Out of control and unpredictable' bushfire burning in Western Australia

image.altText: Viona Agung is standing in front of a cafe, holding her smartphone up to capture a QR code displayed on the front counter.

props.synopsis: Viona is a cashback app user who has earned hundreds of dollars in cashback, but consumer advocacy group CHOICE is warning of privacy and personal data collection concerns.

title.children: Cashback apps boast millions of Australian users. But what price are you willing to pay for 'free' money?

image.altText: Three women stand together on the sidewalk with the ocean in the background.

props.synopsis: A trip to Australia turned into an unexpected family reunion for an English woman whose partner used a 25-year-old postcard and social media to track down relations.

title.children: How an old postcard helped Sarah find her nan on the opposite side of the world

image.altText: Large radio telescopes in the outback with a star filled sky.

props.synopsis: Humans have long been fascinated by how aliens could communicate — it's the plot of countless blockbuster science fiction films. Yet there's also a team of experts who are investigating this idea.

title.children: Meet the team preparing for the possibility that intelligent life exists beyond our galaxy

image.altText: Two women crouch down to light candles in a crowd of people at a vigil

props.synopsis: A branch of Islamic State, the militant group that once sought control over swathes of Iraq and Syria, has claimed responsibility for a deadly terrorist attack at a Moscow concert hall. Here's what we know about ISIS-K.

title.children: Why is Islamic State 'fixated' on Russia?

image.altText: woman in a cream sweater lies on a couch with white headphones on

props.synopsis: Climate activist Greta Thunberg describes herself as having Asperger's while others on the autism spectrum, such as comedian Hannah Gatsby, describe themselves as "autistic". But what's the difference?

title.children: What’s the difference between autism and Asperger’s disorder?

image.altText: Valentino Guseli holds the World Cup crystal globe in Silvaplana, Switzerland.

props.synopsis: Australian teen snowboarder Valentino Guseli underlines his phenomenal talent with another World Cup crystal globe as the season's overall park and pipe champion.

title.children: Aussie snowboard ace Guseli wins back-to-back World Cup crystal globes

image.altText: Rochelle smiles in her jockey silks and helmet to a crowd of supporters.

props.synopsis: When Rochelle Milnes became an apprentice jockey in 2022 it was against her parents' wishes over fears for her safety. But she quickly discovered an industry that was embracing women with gusto.

title.children: 'Go the girl power': Women dominating new jockey ranks as racing sheds gender bias

image.altText: Torrie Lewis

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Torrie Lewis anchors her relay team to victory in the 4x100m at the Sydney Track Classic, breaking a longstanding record along the way.

title.children: Teen sprint sensation Torrie Lewis helps Aussie relay team break 24-year-old record

image.altText: Two ladies wearing feathered and formal attire sit in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: For decades, women's only spaces have faced repeated challenges from men who say their missing out amounts to sex discrimination. So in 2024, is there still room for women-only — or men-only, for that matter — spaces?

title.children: No men allowed: The battle over women-only spaces continues

image.altText: A man in a swimsuit and chains stands on the top of a bridge in a 1900s photograph

props.synopsis: Harry Houdini had issued a challenge to every magician, illusionist and escapologist in the world — perform any trick for him three times, he said, and he could tell you how it was done. On what would have been his 150th birthday, here's the trick that stumped him.

title.children: ‘It completely fooled him’: How a 27-year-old portrait artist left Harry Houdini stumped

image.altText: Woman with pixie cut style blonde hair smiles into camera.

props.synopsis: A police investigation determined religious extremism motivated Franke and business partner Jodi Hildebrandt to convince Franke's young children they were evil, subjecting them to conditions an attorney has described as "concentration camp-like."

title.children: 'I will not feed a demon': YouTuber Ruby Franke's child abuse case rooted in religious extremism

image.altText: A man in a suit wearing a blue tie stands at a podium, with four women behind him.

props.synopsis: Political parties that suffer a big drop in their vote and are on track to fall at short of a majority don't often claim victory, but that's exactly what Jeremy Rockliff did, writes Adam Langenberg.

title.children: The 'victory' speech despite no victory and other oddities of Tasmania's election night

image.altText: A man stands at a podium with microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says it is time for Israel to provide an "ironclad commitment" to unfettered access to humanitarian goods throughout Gaza, as fighting rages on around the strip's main hospital.

title.children: Visiting Rafah's border, UN secretary-general calls blocked aid for Gaza a 'moral outrage'

image.altText: A black and white mountain landscape, obscured by fog, displayed on backlit film.

props.synopsis: Sámi artist Ellen Dahl has won the National Photography Prize from the Murray Art Museum Albury for a series of photographs taken in remote Norway.

title.children: $30,000 national photography prize won by artist exploring climate change and coal mining in the Arctic
